constructs.name: Emotional Awareness
constructs.definition: Recognition and acknowledgment of one's own emotional states, including naming emotions or describing emotional experiences.
examples: I felt sad when that happened
I noticed I was getting anxious
There was a bit of guilt that came in

constructs.name: Family Dynamics
constructs.definition: Description of relationships, interactions, or patterns within family systems, including both nuclear and extended family.
examples: My relationship with my sister has been complicated
We're really close as a family

constructs.name: Self-Reflection
constructs.definition: Instances where the speaker examines their own thoughts, behaviors, motivations, or personal growth.
examples: I realized that I need to give more
Looking back, I think I could have handled it differently
I've been thinking about why I react that way

constructs.name: Interpersonal Conflict
constructs.definition: Description of disagreements, friction, or tension in relationships with others.
examples: We had a bit of a disagreement
I've got a bit of a beef with her

constructs.name: Coping Strategies
constructs.definition: Methods or approaches the speaker uses to manage stress, difficult emotions, or challenging situations.
examples: I try to let it go
I just focus on staying calm
I give myself space to process

constructs.name: Personal Growth Intention
constructs.definition: Expressed desires or goals for self-improvement, personal development, or positive change.
examples: I want to be a better father
I'm working on being more patient
I need to give more to my family
